title: Buryatia
summary: The Republic of Buryatia (Russian: Республика Бурятия; Buryat: Буряад Улас, romanized: Buryaad Ulas, pronounced [bʊˈrʲɑːt ʊˈlɑs], Mongolian: Буриад Улс, romanized: Buriad Uls) is a federal subject of Russia (a republic), located in Siberia. Formerly part of the Siberian Federal District, it has been a part of the Russian Far East since 2018.[11] Its capital is the city of Ulan-Ude. Its area is 351,300 square kilometers (135,600 sq mi) with a population of 972,021 (2010 Census).[6]
